context.title: AnnotationType
context.description: AnnotationTypes can be used to tag ROOM classes for further custom processing.

context.title: Annotation
context.description: An Annotation can be attached to a ROOM classes to apply the properties of its AnnotationType.

context.title: Inheritance
context.description: A class can specify a super class and inherits elements from the super class hierarchy.

context.title: PhysicalModel
context.description: The PhysicalModel defines the setup of your nodes with their attributes like threads and mode of execution.

context.title: MappingModel
context.description: The MappingModel describes the mapping of elements of the LogicalModel to elements of the PhysicalModel.

context.title: ConfigModel
context.description: The ConfigModel describes the Attribute configuration of ActorInstances and PortInstances.

context.title: LogicalModel
context.description: The LogicalModel describes the logical structure and behavior of a ROOM application.

context.title: LogicalSystem
context.description: The LogicalSystem is the topmost structural class. It assembles a distributed system by means of sub systems.

context.title: ActorClass
context.description: An actor is the basic structural building block for building systems with ROOM.

context.title: SubSystemClass
context.description: A SubSystem is the topmost building block of the executable part of an system.

context.title: StateMachine
context.description: A StateMachine describes the state based, event driven behavior of an ActorClass.

context.title: SubSystemRef
context.description: A Sub System Reference is an instance of an SubSystemClass

context.title: Replication
context.description: Replication is mechanism for multi instantiation for ActorRefs and Ports.

context.title: ActorRef
context.description: An ActorRef is an instance of an ActorClass.

context.title: Binding
context.description: A Binding connects two Ports with each other.

context.title: LayerConnection
context.description: A LayerConnection associates a SPP to an ActorRef, resulting in an connection of all SAPs on its instance hierarchy.

context.title: ExecutionType
context.description: Determines the execution type of an actor.

context.title: CommunicationType
context.description: The CommunicationType defines the communication semantics of a ProtocolClass.

context.title: ProtocolClass
context.description: A ProtocolClass defines messages and is the interface specification for a Port

context.title: DataType
context.description: A DataType can take 4 forms and types data elements like an Attribute or Operation argument.

context.title: PrimitiveType
context.description: A PrimitiveType is an abstraction of a target language's basic type (e.g. integer or boolean).

context.title: Enumeration
context.description: An EnumerationType declares an enumeration similar to most well-known languages.

context.title: DataClass
context.description: A DataClass is a composition of Attributes.

context.title: ExternalType
context.description: An ExternalType is used to make an target language type accessible in ROOM.

context.title: Attribute
context.description: An Attribute is a member variable of a class

context.title: Operation
context.description: An Operation is a member function of a class.

context.title: Port
context.description: A Port is an instance of a ProtocolClass and the interface for an ActorClass.

context.title: RelayPort
context.description: A RelayPort forwards its messages without exposing them to the internal interface of the ActorClass.

context.title: ExternalEndPort
context.description: A ExternalEndPort is an interface Port, that is made accessible to the internal interface of an ActorClass.

context.title: InternalEndPort
context.description: A InternalEndPort is an local Port, that is declared in the internal interface of an ActorClass.

context.title: SAP
context.description: A Service Access Point is similar to a Port, but uses a LayerConnection for wiring.

context.title: ServiceImplementation
context.description: The implementation of an Service Provision Point (SPP).

context.title: SPP
context.description: A Service Provision Point is the counterpart of a SAP
